did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Materials related to trans activism and Asian American, queer, and transgender identities, including correspondence and materials related to a 2001 Transgender Law and Policy Roundtable sponsored by the Center for Lesbian and Gay Studies (CLAGS) of the City University of New York.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Transgender activist and 2006 Cornell English Ph.D., Juang was a leader in organizing Cornell's first transgender conference, TransPositions, that took place on March 27-29, 1998.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Materials related to trans activism and Asian American, queer, and transgender identities, including correspondence and materials related to a 2001 Transgender Law and Policy Roundtable sponsored by the Center for Lesbian and Gay Studies (CLAGS) of the City University of New York.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Richard Milton Juang papers, #7764. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIALS
relatedmaterial.p: Related collection: TransPositions: A Conference toward Transgender Studies, records, #53-15-3782.
